author: metachris_
content: Yep, that makes sense - we're onboard with a delayed activation of mev-boost, to reduce immediate complexity at the merge. At the workshop on Friday there was agreement on that as well. CL clients would start interacting with mev-boost only after a number of slots or epochs. And additionally the builder/relay can gradually ramp up to full output, or stop it if need be.

author: tersec
content: It does create an additional configuration complexity, probably -- either it's sort of hard-coded into CLs, or there's dynamic configuration going on people might not otherwise have much use for -- but agree that the goal at least is worthwhile.

author: tersec
content:
It's useful that it's something CLs can enforce, because they can use use their engine API ELs for that time period.

One question is whether this should be extended anywhere beyond mainnet.

author: ryanleeschneider
content:
> One question is whether this should be extended anywhere beyond mainnet.

IMO yes just to be sure the code works in all clients, but I guess that could be covered by enabling in an upcoming shadow fork.
